text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
WHOHIVAdaptationKitModel Element
patient 1..*BackboneElementPatient
name 1..*HumanNamePatient's name
identification 1..1BackboneElementPatient identification
uniqueId 1..1stringUnique ID
nationalId 0..1stringNational ID
nationalHealthId 0..1stringNational health ID
nationalProgramId 0..1stringNational program ID
nationalHealthInsuranceId 0..1stringNational health insurance ID
countryOfBirth 1..1codeCountry of birth
dateOfBirth 0..1dateDate of birth
dateOfBirthUnknown 0..1booleanDate of birth unknown
age 0..1SimpleQuantityAge
estimatedAge 0..1SimpleQuantityEstimated age
gender 1..1codePatient gender
Binding: VSPatientGender (required)
genderIdentity 0..1codeGender identity
Binding: VSPatientGenderIdentity (required)
address 1..1stringAddress
telephoneNumber 1..1stringTelephone Number
administrativeArea 1..1CodeableConceptAdministrative Area
communicationConsent 0..1booleanCommunication Consent
reminderMessages 0..1booleanReminder messages
communicationPreferences 0..1codeCommunication preference(s)
email 0..1stringClient's E-mail
alternateContact 0..1BackboneElementAlternate contact
name 0..1stringAlternate contact's name
phoneNumber 0..1stringAlternate contact's phone number
address 0..1stringAlternate contact's address
relationship 0..1codeAlternate contact relationship
visit 1..*BackboneElementVisit
date 1..1dateVisit date
referral 1..*BackboneElementReferral
referred 0..1booleanReferred
referrer 0..1stringReferred by
reason 1..1BackboneElementReason for HIV testing services visit
firstTimeHIVTest 0..1booleanFirst encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
hivRetest 0..1booleanRetesting for human immunodeficiency virus
referredByPartnerServices 1..1BackboneElementReferred through partner services
indexCase 0..1booleanPartner or contact of an index case
non-indexCase 0..1booleanPartner or contact of an HIV testing client (non-index case)
typeOfContact 0..1codingType of contact or partner for partner services
Binding: Type of contact or relationship (extensible)
exposureToHIV
date 0..1dateDateTime of suspected exposure to HIV

Documentation for this format

name: WHOHIVAdaptationKitModel
description: This logical model reflects the WHO HIV Digital Accelerator Kit data dictionary

element.definition: Base definition for all elements in a resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Patient info
Patient's name
Patient Identification
Unique identifier generated for new clients or a universal ID, if used in the country.
National unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country.
National health unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country.
National program unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country.
National health insurance unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country.
Country where the client was born
The client's date of birth (DOB) if known.
Select this if the client's DOB is unknown.
Calculated age (number of years) of the client based on date of birth
If DOB is unknown, enter the client's estimated age. Display client's age in number of years.
Patient gender
The gender that the client identifies with
Client's home address or address at which the client is consenting to disclose
Can be a landline or a mobile phone number

This should be a context-specific list of administrative areas, such as villages, districts, etc. The purpose of this data element is to allow for grouping and flagging of client data to a particular facility's catchment area. This can be input into the system by the end user OR it can be automated in the database based on the end user's attributes
Indication that client gave consent to be contacted
Whether client wants to receive text or other messages as follow-up for family planning
text-message | voice-call
Client's primary email account where the client can be contacted
An alternate contact, which could be next of kin (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.). The alternate contact would be used in the case of an emergency situation.
Name of alternate contact
Phone number of the alternate contact.
Alternate contact's home address or address at which the client able to disclose.
The alternate contact's relationship to the client (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.).
Patient's visits
The date and time of the client's visit
If client was referred for care
If client was referred for care
Referred by the Community level services / health facility

element.short: Reason for HIV testing services visit
First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
element.definition: First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
Retesting for human immunodeficiency virus
Client reported coming to the facility after receiving a provider-assisted referral or patient referral from a contact or partner.

element.short: Partner or contact of an index case
element.definition: The client is a contact or partner of a person diagnosed with HIV (an index case).

element.short: Partner or contact of an HIV testing client (non-index case)
element.definition: The client is a contact or partner identified through partner or social network services, but is not known to be a partner of an index-case.

element.short: Type of contact or partner for partner services
element.definition: Client's relationship to the person that referred the client for partner services or family services

element.short: DateTime of suspected exposure to HIV
element.definition: Date and time when the client had suspected exposure to HIV

text-message | voice-call
Client's primary email account where the client can be contacted

Patient's visits

Referred by the Community level services / health facility

element.short: Reason for HIV testing services visit
First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
element.definition: First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
Retesting for human immunodeficiency virus
Client reported coming to the facility after receiving a provider-assisted referral or patient referral from a contact or partner.

element.definition: The client is a contact or partner of a person diagnosed with HIV (an index case).
